fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42709].
  {panel}

The actual page [Allowing users to create issue anonimously|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Allowing+users+to+create+issues+anonymously] could be more clear. Some users (as you can see [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/132222/how-can-i-allow-anonymous-users-to-create-issues]) are missing the step to make the Reporter optional. I suggest changing this documentation to something similar to the following:

{quote}
JIRA can be configured to allow users to create issues without having logged into JIRA. There are two related actions:

# Allowing users to browse and search issues in the project without logging in.
## Add the Anyone group to the *Browse Project* ﻿of permissions in the permission scheme for the project.
# Allowing users to create issues in that project without logging in.
## Add the Anyone group to the *Create Issue* of permissions in the permission scheme for the project.
## Set the *Reporter﻿* at the project's field configuration scheme to optional.
Any issue created by a user who is not logged in will display 'Anonymous' for the reporter of the issue.
{\quote}

Best regards,
Daniel P Santos
fields.summary: Reduce the customer friction from an Atlassian Document page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is missing the "Browse Users" global permission the tooltip message displayed is "You do not have permissions to browse the list of groups"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in with a user without "Browse Users"
# Go to the Manage Watchers page in an issue
# Hover over the Lock icon next to the Watchers field

h3. Expected Results
A message stating the user can't browse the list of users should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The message "You do not have permissions to browse the list of groups" is displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42705].
  {panel}

As a JIRA System Administrator, I'd like to be able to manage user memberships easily.

In JIRA 6.4, when you go to _Users > username > Actions > Edit User Groups_ you need to type and choose a group. While in older versions it was possible to select all groups at once. Or to select multiple ones by holding CMD and clicking.

In addition, it is not possible anymore to see the full list of available groups from the drop down.
This can be very inconvenient, in particular when users are required to get added to a large amount of groups manually.
fields.summary: Change edit group membership to a multi-select field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42704].
  {panel}

Hello,

We currently use Jira OnDemand, and I've set up several dashboards for use in our regular meetings. I've also got lots of filters set up to help us navigate to the relevant issue lists for each section of the meeting.

What I'd like to see is a gadget similar to the "Favourite Filters" gadget, but instead of only showing the favourite filters (where each user can only have one list), you can specify a list of filters to use in this instance of the gadget. That way I could have a different filter list on each dashboard, and also have other information and graphs on there.

At present I've achieved this using multiple "Filter Results" gadgets and limiting to one item per list, but this isn't practical and a list of filters in the same format as "Favourite Filters" would be much better. I looked into writing my own, but apparently you can't write custom gadgets for OnDemand (accoriding to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Restricted+Functions+in+Cloud+Applications)

I tried searching the project for existing items but couldn't seem to find anything, apologies if I missed it.

Many thanks,
James
fields.summary: "Selected Filters" Gadget for OnDemand

Steps to Reproduce:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42687].
  {panel}

As an admin, I would like to configure a notification to HipChat when an issue is commented. 

It would be good if:
* I can choose what issues trigger notifications using JQL 
* I can choose to include the body of the comment in the notification to HipChat
** I may want to include the comment body, or I may just want a notification saying "Comment Added" or something similar.

A workaround is discussed in [this Answers post | https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/186544/posting-jira-issue-comments-to-hipchat]
fields.summary: Notify HipChat when JIRA issue is commented

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42686].
  {panel}

The old XML-RPC API provided a method for getting the list of suggested labels using the endpoint: /rest/api/1.0/labels/suggest

This API is very useful for clients to provide feedback to users and keep the set of used labels consistent.

According to the [deprecation notice|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/api-reference/jira-api-status/jira-rpc-services/jira-xml-rpc-overview/soap-and-xml-rpc-api-deprecation-notice] for the XML-RPC and SOAP APIs it looks like this endpoint will not be supported in JIRA 7.0.  I don't see it in the current Javadoc for the SOAP API that is targeted for migration.

Given that the JIRA OnDemand web UI uses this deprecated call too I suggest it be announced as officially supported in JIRA 7.0.
fields.summary: Provide REST API for listing the set of know labels

fields.description:
If the usernames are same as emails or if they have '@' symbol in the username, the URL that comes in the email for the Password Reset replaces the @ symbol with the URL escape character %40.

Due to this, clicking on the reset URL throws and error stating that the username is not found. Users are unable to reset the password due to this.
fields.summary: Password Reset with Usernames with @

fields.description:
h4. Expected behaviour
Search for issues normally or report error in query.

h4. Actual behaviour
No issues appear nor any error message regarding errors in query's syntax. See screenshots below:
!Capture 2015-03-06 at 5.39.31.png|thumbnail!
!Capture 2015-03-06 at 5.39.47.png|thumbnail!
!Capture 2015-03-06 at 5.49.50.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
Escape the operators in the query by adding {{//}} before.

*Notes:*
* Issue was replicated on a clean instance (v. 6.4);
* It happens in other text fields as well (e.g. Description);
* The {{*}} causes the same behaviour;
fields.summary: Issue with wildcard operators in searching for issues

fields.description:
Steps to reproduced.

- Unpack a Jira 6.2.5 and install it. (New directory for this, new JIRA_HOME. Use built-in database, no special anything. One user, admin, which is used for the steps below.
- Create a project (using Jira classic workflow, though this shouldn't matter). (Actually, this project shouldn't even be needed, I realise now; this step should be ignored.) 
- Create a few screens. I added one fairly randomly selected field to each screen, just because. 
- Create a new workflow using diagram mode. Add a few statuses, and some transitions between them, using any of my new screens. 
- Export the workflow, as workflow, not xml.
- Shut down this Jira.
- Unpack a new Jira and install as above. Use new JIRA_HOME and new directory, of course.
- Import the recently created workflow. 
- Edit workflow in text mode, try to edit transition, see Jira crash, as per the screen shots.
fields.summary: Error Screen with imported workflow with Non existing screen while editing in Text Mode.
Move "Cancel" link to another place on the create issue form

fields.description:
When a project has a key that is a keyword (ie. "IS" or "OR") then the Issues screen with appear blank.

The jql sent is something akin to
project = OR AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY priority DESC, updated DESC

This results in a bad request to the restful API.

It needs to be changed to encapsulate the project name to prevent keyword issues:
project = "OR" AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY priority DESC, updated DESC
fields.summary: Issues tab on Project page breaks with some Project Keys
Would like to mass sort custom field and edit individual values across a group of issues

  {panel}

h3. Summary
This is a logging bug. There seems to be no functional problem from the UI side.

When clicking on an mp4 attachment, it will play the video in the web browser with no indication of any problem, but JIRA logs a {{ClientAbortException}}.
* This doesn't seem to happen for small files that are less than 1 MB (rought estimate)
* For files that are a couple MB in size, it happens upon first request, but not after. I believe this is because of caching
* I've been able to always reproduce this with larger files of great than a couple hundred MB

h3. Environment
Reproducible on the browsers below: 
- Chrome 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit) 
- Safari 7.1 (9537.85.10.17.1)

The error does not happen when streaming the video on Firefox 37.0.2. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a .mp4 video file to an issue ticket (e.g. [^SampleVideo_360x240_5mb.mp4]).
#* Use larger files for best results
# Click on the video, which will cause it to start playing in your web browser

No errors are written to the logs.

fields.description:
It looks like when using <= in certain contexts, it only computes LESS THAN, not also OR EQUAL.

PREREQUISITES
Make sure you have at least one issue created on the chosen end date.

STEPS
1. Perform an advanced search for issues, like:
*AND created >= 2015-03-20 AND created <= 2015-03-26 ORDER BY created DESC*

2. Look at the results list.

CURRENT
No issues created on 2015-03-26 will display.

EXPECTED
Issues created on 2015-03-26 should display, as the <= operator should include the end date as a valid value for *created*.

ADDITIONAL INFO
- The operator is broken even when using it in simpler queries:
*project = <projectkey> AND created <= 2015-03-26 ORDER BY created DESC*
- It does not matter if you use the date format like this: *"YYYY/MM/DD"* or like that: *YYYY-MM-DD*
- It also applies for simple searches, when you select an interval for Created via the calendar drop down, as the calendar period drop down uses this same operator.

Also see attachment, where the first list is using <= DESIRED DAY and getting no results for that day and the second list uses <= DESIRED DAY+1 and gets results for the DESIRED DAY.

Virtually, it's as if *<=* simply does *<*= but no <*=*

*NOTE*
>= works fine, it's only <= that's acting up

*ADDITIONAL INFO*
Also reproduces within OnDemand JIRA so I guess it pretty much affects most recent versions.
fields.summary: [Queries] [Logical Operators] <= Operator ignores =

fields.description:
*Symptom*
* Activity Stream throws 'No activity was found' all the time

*Diagnosis*
* JIRA running behind Ngin-x proxy, once the Ngin-x proxy is disabled or bypassed, the Activity Stream works correctly
* Response header "Content-Encoding" will be empty

*Root Cause*
* Activity Stream has Content-Encoding header set to empty value and this is against the RFC 7231

*Workaround*
* Disabling GZIP of mime type "application/atom+xml" in the Ngin-x proxy configuration will avoid this problem.
fields.summary: Activity Stream Throws No Activity Was Found Message Consistently

fields.description:
When screens are configured so that the Time tracking and Log work can be done from the same screen, there Changelog does not correctly represent Remaining estimate changes.

To repeat:
# Configure Issue screens to have Time tracking and Log work in the same screen. See Screenshot 1 in attachment
# Create a new issue without specifying it's Original estimate
# Go to edit this issue and follow to the newly created tab with Time tracking
# Add Original estimate and before saving also add the Log Work with the same amount of time as the created estimate. Leave Remaining Estimate to adjust automatically. See attached Screenshot 2
# When this work log entry is saved there are two History entries. See attached Screenshot 3. The first entry correctly shows Original estimate (though not user friendly, but in seconds), Time spent and no remaining estimate. The second entry is added though exactly with the same timestamp setting the Remaining estimate to 2 days.

It would be OK if the estimate would be set in one of entries and then removed in the next one (see Screenshot 4 for a normal case issue when Original estimate was added during creation and later work was logged), but none of these entries actually does this. 

In case of going through issue changelog (see attached changelog json) the remaining estimate is only changed to value and never changed 'from' leaving resulting remaining estimate as 2d.
fields.summary: Remaining estimate is not changed in Changelog when Original estimate and Time logged are done at the same time

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42617].
  {panel}

The "Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy" option available in JIRA's General Configuration page can be used to turn off rendering of inline attachment including images when set to "Secure: forced download of attachments for all browsers". 

However it appears it's possible to escape this rendering setting for the inline image markup by using it with other wiki markup such as a pipe/quote/numbered/bulleted lists to the inline image markup.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Set "Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy" to "Secure: forced download of attachments for all browsers" in General Configurations.
* Try to render an image attachment inline using \!image.png\!
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \|\!image.png\! as well.
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \*\!image.png\! as well.
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \#\!image.png\! as well.
* Try adding a pipe in front of the markup as in \{quote}\!image.png\! \{quote} as well.

*Expected Behavior*
* Image is not rendered in any of the above cases based on the setting

*Actual behavior*
* Image is rendered when markup is used along with the pipe/quote/numbered/bulleted lists etc.
fields.summary: Certain wiki markup characters can be used to escape Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy

java.lang.RuntimeException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:UserAssociation][sinkNodeId,10000][created,2015-03-24 17:22:36.314][associationType,WatchIssue][sourceName,0kx6mgijojraldzx5dtxcc9gvougq302bw1cdsyxeejfjpq8xujqw3krxy8akepecqvui7t54xj6gfjt][sinkNodeEntity,Issue] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO userassociation (SOURCE_NAME, SINK_NODE_ID, SINK_NODE_ENTITY, ASSOCIATION_TYPE, SEQUENCE, CREATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'SOURCE_NAME' at row 1))
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$2.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1.execute(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.dispatch(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:60)
....
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:UserAssociation][sinkNodeId,10000][created,2015-03-24 17:22:36.314][associationType,WatchIssue][sourceName,0kx6mgijojraldzx5dtxcc9gvougq302bw1cdsyxeejfjpq8xujqw3krxy8akepecqvui7t54xj6gfjt][sinkNodeEntity,Issue] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO userassociation (SOURCE_NAME, SINK_NODE_ID, SINK_NODE_ENTITY, ASSOCIATION_TYPE, SEQUENCE, CREATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'SOURCE_NAME' at row 1))

....
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:UserAssociation][sinkNodeId,10000][created,2015-03-24 17:22:36.314][associationType,WatchIssue][sourceName,0kx6mgijojraldzx5dtxcc9gvougq302bw1cdsyxeejfjpq8xujqw3krxy8akepecqvui7t54xj6gfjt][sinkNodeEntity,Issue] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO userassociation (SOURCE_NAME, SINK_NODE_ID, SINK_NODE_ENTITY, ASSOCIATION_TYPE, SEQUENCE, CREATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'SOURCE_NAME' at row 1))
...	
{code}

h3. Notes
Renaming the username does not fix the problem. 

h3. Workaround
PostgreSQL
{code:SQL}
alter table userassociation alter column SOURCE_NAME type varchar (255);
{code}
MySQL
{code:sql}
alter table userassociation modify SOURCE_NAME varchar(255) COLLATE utf8_bin NOT NULL;
{code}
* (!) *Always backup your database before modifying you database directly*

fields.description:
Tempo Planner, Folio and Books are disabled on JIRA 6.4 after restart.

We had to remove the JIRA 6.4 compatibility for these products. Is there a workaround that we can publish to our customers that they can use until a fix is released?

It appears as everything works when we run our environment with atlas-run-standalone. Then if we restart it (just ctrl+C and run it up again) the products are not enabled. We have to manually install these plugins again in the UPM and that is quite sub-optimal.

Additionally, JIRA 6.4 server is affected. We set up a JIRA 6.4 instance to verify that this problem was only limited to using the atlas-run-standalone command but the atlassian-jira-6.4.tar.gz file provided by Atlassian must be broken since we can access everything in the Admin section except the Add-ons section. There we get a 404 error despite having the correct URL.

When one of our Timesheets developers first tried to see if the plugin worked on JIRA 6.4 last November, he experienced these difficulties and contacted Bradley Ayers from Atlassian. He gave us this answer:

"After having a chat with the plugin system team, I've come to the conclusion that the 6.4-m09 milestone is broken, and it's something we'll need to fix before 6.4 final is released. If this is blocking your development (e.g. you need to test JIRA startup behaviour), there's a work around you can use until we fix this within JIRA:
Make a copy of tenant-smart-patterns.txt, add your other plugin key to it, and then set the system property atlassian.plugins.tenant.smart.patterns to point to the new file."

This workaround fixes our problems, but we thought that it should have been fixed by now. Can we do something else than this workaround? What should we tell our customers who are running our products on JIRA 6.4? Should we tell our customers to add the artifact ids to the tenant file as a short term solution?

Thank you very much, I hope you understand that this is quite urgent.
fields.summary: Tempo products are disabled on JIRA 6.4 after restart

Once the Linked Issues field is hidden; *it should be hidden in the issue view screen*. When REST API to query issue is used; it doesn't return the issueLink in the JSON response.

h3.Actual Results:
Once the Linked Issues field is hidden; *it still shows in the issue view screen* but when REST API to query issue is used; it doesn't return the issueLink in the JSON response.

h3.Workaround:
Show the Linked Issues field again and the JSON response will return the issueLink.

h3.Notes
In my opinion; if choices are given to the user to either show or hide the *Linked Issues* field; the changes should be reflected in the issue view screen. Otherwise; it's better to disable users from hiding or showing the said field all together.
fields.summary: REST API not returning IssueLinks in JSON response if Linked Issues field is disabled

fields.description:
The opaque background blinks when an add-on is installed/updated

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install a vanilla JIRA 6.4
# Navigate to the *Find new add-ons* page and install an add-on

OR
# Install a vanilla JIRA 6.4
# Navigate to the *Manage add-ons* page and there will be some add-on updates available
# Update any add-on

h4. Expected Behaviour
# A progress dialogue pops up, while the rest of the page greys out
# The progress bar will display install/update progress while the background maintains opaque

h4. Actual Behaviour
# A progress dialogue pops up, while the rest of the page greys out
# When install/update is in progress, the background will _blink_ back and forth from opaque to full coloured

h4. Notes
# Reproduced with Safari, Chrome and Firefox. Didn't test IE
fields.summary: Background blinks when installing/updating add-on

  {panel}

When viewing the attachment list through EDIT view screen, all the attachment files will not show in the browser window. 

!edit.png|thumbnail!

When adding comment it will show all the attachment list

*Feature Request* 
Ability to view all the attachment list through EDIT view screen in Attachment Links

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an issue has a {{NULL}} priority, attempting to update the priority for that issue via the REST API will return a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# For one type of issue, hide the "Priority" field.
# For a second type of issue, create a new Field Configuration Scheme, and ensure the priority field is shown
# Create an issue of the first type (ensuring there is no Priority field present, and that the {{priority}} column in the {{jiraissue}} table is {{NULL}}
# Change the issue type manually in the "View Issue" screen - the type will change, but the value will not be adjusted (even if the field is required)

h3. Summary

There is a known compatibility issue that prevents the user management synchronisation between JIRA 6.4 and Stash 3.4.3+. 

This will only affect you if you use JIRA to manage your Stash users. The bug in Stash is being tracked on [STASH-7195|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-7195].


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Stash 3.4.3+ with JIRA 6.4 configured as its User Management Server. To perform that, please refer to [Connecting Stash to JIRA for user management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Connecting+Stash+to+JIRA+for+user+management].
# Perform Synchronisation

h3. Expected Results

Synchronisation should work just fine.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-stash.log}} file:

h3.Solution / Workaround

As [STASH-7195|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-7195] has been closed and shipped in Stash 3.7.2 you can either:

fields.description:
My CustomField [Checklist|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.okapya.jira.checklist ] is now being displayed in JIRA 6.4 with a Simple Wiki Renderer Toolbar. My customfield is not a text based customfield. It derives from AbstractMultiCFType. However, the field rendering HTML includes a TextArea so I assume that the Wiki Renderer Toolbar wrongly assumes that my CustomField requires one.

As of now, I have numerous requests from my customers to update my CustomField to support JIRA 6.4 but cannot do it. How can I turn off the renderer toolbar? Since it is not a text customfield, I cannot set the renderer in the customfield configuration page.
fields.summary: Simple Wiki Renderer appears for not Text based Custom Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42558].
  {panel}

If you go to to >>
- administration cog
- Issues
- Custom Fields
- Select configure on a custom field
-- https://<INSTANCE NAME>/secure/admin/ConfigureCustomField!default.jspa?customFieldId=<CUSTOM FIELD ID#####>

The Wrench Option and delete option are very close together and accidentally clicking the Delete option while clicking the Wrench will immediately delete the context without warning.  

h2.Suggestion:
Add a popup warning notifying that you are deleting the custom context with option to cancel

h2.Suggestion to Users:
Use the Edit Configuration Link rather than the wrench icon.
fields.summary: Delete Custom context too close to edit and needs warning on delete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42556].
  {panel}

While HiChat may seem as an interesting option for small comanies or for very small teams that do work totally isolated from the rest of the company, it has almost no chances to sucess in Corporate.

Most corporations are using Microsoft Lync and some of them do also use the XMPP interface for Lync.

Use case: the entire company is using Lynx for internal communications (>10k employes) and we do want to benefit from IM integration in Jira and Confluence.

Third Party Connector for JIRA Server
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.benryan.jira.plugin.lync-connector

Third Party Connector for Confluence Server
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.benryan.confluence.plugin.lync-connector

Neither are available for Cloud.
Neither provide the notification abilities of HipChat
fields.summary: Support for Lync in JIRA and HipChat

fields.description:
h4. Summary
The current bundled UPM version with JIRA 6.4 and 6.3.15 is *2.17.13*.

There are a lot of Critical issues fixed since:
https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20UPM%20AND%20fixVersion%20%3E%202.17.13%20and%20resolution%20%3D%20Fixed%20ORDER%20BY%20priority%20DESC%2C%20created%20ASC

Which include [UPM-4877|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-4877], that is causing a lot of friction with out customers and interactions with Support.

CC: [~gdavidson@atlassian.com] / [~jpendleton]

h4. Incompatible with product license (wrong type)
For users facing this error, please [update the Universal Plugin Manager|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Updating+add-ons] to the latest available version (2.18.2) through the *Administration > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons* page.

Atlassian JIRA Project Management Software (v6.3.3#6331-sha1:d919e5c)
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Using JIRA 6.3.1, connect it to a Confluence instance
# Try to link a JIRA ticket to a Confluence page, using the 'Search for a page' functionality
# It will fail/get stuck (no errors in the GUI), but if the development tools are used, this can be seen :

!applink.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional info :

* If the user links the page directly via the URL of the Confluence page, it will work with no problem
* Other applink functionalities (such as JIRA Issue Macro) seems to be working fine
* This appears to only happen in JIRA 6.3.1. During the test, it was connected with Confluence 5.5.3 

h3. Workaround

For now, I would recommend that the links from JIRA issue to Confluence page be done directly via the URL of the page
fields.summary: Unable to link JIRA issue to Confluence page (500 Internal Server Error)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42551].
  {panel}

*oops, I just found JRA-40284. Mine is a duplicate of that one-- but I don't have permission to resolve my own issue as duplicate. Sorry JIRA team about the spam!*

When I'm creating a new issue, it's often related to the current page I'm viewing. For example, when viewing a list of issues, I may want to refer to the issue number of an existing issue in the description of the new issue. Or when reviewing a resolved issue, I may spot a problem with the solution that we'll need to address in a future release. 

But because the create dialog hides a large percentage of the screen, I often can't see the info in back that I need to refer to in my issue. This means I often have to decide to either abandon my new issue and re-type whatever I've typed so far, or to save the incomplete issue and immediately edit it. 

I know that I can open the create form in a new tab and bypassed this problem, but often I don't realize that I need info from the page until after I'm already midway through entering info in the dialog.

Could JIRA modal dialogs be enhanced to allow moving dialog boxes out of the way by making the dialog header draggable?  

FWIW, most modern web apps already support this behavior, perhaps because jquery.dialog and other frameworks' dialog widgets offer this behavior by default.
fields.summary: As an issue creator, I want to drag the modal dialog out of the way so I can see what's in back of it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42547].
  {panel}

https://jira.atlassian.com/ ->
in my profile, change page size from default of 50 to 1000 ->
navbar -> Issues -> Reported by Me ->
observe 3 (soon to be 4 issues) in results (I use List View) ->
click the circled x beside 'Reporter: Current User', removing that criteria from the filter ->

Actual result:
observe a very long pause where nothing is happening ->
observe 1000 results displayed

Expected result:
observe a throbber indicating progress is occuring ->
observe 1000 results displayed

Without a throbber, it looks like the query has failed silently. In fact it is succeeding silently.

The throbber from the Activity Stream would be sufficient.
fields.summary: Filter queries don't have a throbber while loading results

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.4, _com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.WebResourceUrlProviderImpl_ now seems to require a valid user in the JiraAuthenticationContext.  This means, that the method _public String getStaticResourcePrefix(UrlMode urlMode)_ now fails with a NPE when this method is invoked from a service context, eg a mail handler.

The cause of this is that there is expected to be a user logged in, it would be really nice to just fallback to the DEFAULT locale instead of generating an NPE, and would allow this method to be used in services...

I've referred a bug as I think this is new behaviour, which is not desirable for any non user-interactive process.
fields.summary: WebResourceUrlProviderImpl.getStaticResourcePrefix requires a non null JiraAuthenticationContext
